title: Syntax for Video Re-encoding (ffmpeg)

labels.name: Another package code issue
labels.description: Bug/issue that relates to a dlc dependency

body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

I don't understand what the syntax error is. I'm trying to re-encode some videos to see if that would resolve my previous issue of no labeled videos being created. I was like to [this post](https://forum.image.sc/t/analyzing-new-videos-no-data/48313/5) as a solution, but couldn't even run the code due to a syntax error.

provided code was `ffmpeg -i "path/to/input.mp4" -c:v libx264 -crf 23 -c:a copy "/path/to/output.mp4"`

### Operating System

Windows

### DeepLabCut version

2.2.0.1

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

CPU

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Open Anaconda Terminal
2. Activate Environment > ipython > import deeplabcut
3. ffmpeg - "C:\Users\Richard\Documents\DeepLabCut\data\30cmPilot.avi" -c:v libx264 -crf23 -c:a copy "C:\Users\Richard\Documents\DeepLabCut\projects\30cmPilot-richard-2021-09-16"

### Relevant log output

```shell
In [7]: ffmpeg - "C:\Users\Richard\Documents\DeepLabCut\data\30cmPilot.avi" -c:v libx264 -crf23 -c:a copy "C:\Users\Ric
   ...: hard\Documents\DeepLabCut\projects\30cmPilot-richard-2021-09-16"
  File "<ipython-input-7-9a5e79c79c7b>", line 1
    ffmpeg - "C:\Users\Richard\Documents\DeepLabCut\data\30cmPilot.avi" -c:v libx264 -crf23 -c:a copy "C:\Users\Richard\Documents\DeepLabCut\projects\30cmPilot-richard-2021-09-16"
                                                                                   ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax
```


### Anything else?

_No response_
